summary: This bill, the Finger Lakes National Heritage Area Act, amends the John D. Dingell, Jr. Conservation, Management, and Recreation Act to designate the Finger Lakes region of New York as a National Heritage Area. It establishes a local coordinating entity (the Finger Lakes Tourism Alliance) to manage the area and requires a management plan to be submitted to the Secretary of the Interior within three years of the bill's enactment. Federal assistance for the area would terminate 15 years after enactment.
